data.title: The Best NBA Players from New York
data.meta_description: Over 1K sports fans have voted on the 90+ athletes on Best NBA Players from New York. Current Top 3: Michael Jordan, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, Julius Erving
data.text:
Ranked By

14.0K votes

1.5K voters

7 reranks

Voting Rules

Only NBA players born or raised in New York.

Who are the best NBA players from New York? Featuring Hall of Fame greats, superstars, and active players, this list of basketball players from New York includes Michael Jordan, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, Julius Erving, and Bernard King. Later generation NBA players, like Carmelo Anthony, Donovan Mitchell, and Kemba Walker, also call NYC home. Who is the best NBA player from New York?

Vote up the top New York NBA players, and help decide the best basketball players from New York. Then head over and check out some more New York star athletes with a list of the best NFL players from New York.

Most divisive: Brendan Haywood

Over 1.5K Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The Best NBA Players from New York

Birthplace : New York City, New York

Team : Chicago Bulls, Washington Wizards

Position : Shooting guard, Small forward

Undeniably one of the most iconic figures in the world of basketball, Michael Jordan's immeasurable talent and relentless work ethic firmly established him as a New York legend. His gravity-defying dunks and unparalleled competitive drive revolutionized the sport, setting the standard for future generations of aspiring athletes. A trailblazer on and off the court, Jordan's impact on the NBA is evident in every facet of the game—from endorsing countless products to inspiring today's elite players, the legacy of "His Airness" remains firmly intact.

Birthplace : New York City, New York

Position : Center

Few players have dominated the hardwood with such grace and prowess as Kareem Abdul-Jabbar—his legendary skyhook was virtually unguardable and a testament to his incomparable skill. The Harlem native's unmatched consistency and longevity allowed him to amass a staggering number of career accolades, solidifying his status as one of the best to ever play the game. Kareem's impact on the NBA extends beyond the court, as he has become an influential advocate for social change and a prominent voice in the fight for civil rights.

Birthplace : Roosevelt, New York

Position : Small forward

Hailing from Long Island, Julius "Dr. J" Erving elevated the art of the dunk, leaving fans in awe with his breathtaking display of aerial acrobatics. Dr. J's groundbreaking style of play not only paved the way for future high-flyers but also played a crucial role in popularizing the sport during the NBA-ABA merger. Overall, Julius Erving's sheer athleticism, combined with his undeniable swagger, remains a significant part of the league's storied history.

Birthplace : Red Hook, New York

Team : Los Angeles Lakers

Position : Small forward

Carmelo Anthony's silky smooth offensive game, marked by his signature mid-range jumpers, brought excitement back to the Madison Square Garden during his tenure with the Knicks. Hailing from Brooklyn, Melo's extraordinary scoring prowess catapulted him into the upper echelon of NBA talent, and his clutch performances endeared him to Knicks fans for years. Despite a tumultuous end to his time in New York, Carmelo Anthony's impact on the court remains etched in the city's storied basketball lore.

5

Donovan Mitchell

Already demonstrating the potential to become one of the best players of his generation, Donovan Mitchell has quickly emerged as one of New York's finest exports. The Westchester County native's explosive athleticism and fearless approach to the game have drawn comparisons to some of the NBA's most legendary shooting guards. With an unwavering commitment to improvement and a burning desire for greatness, Donovan Mitchell's future in the league shines brightly.

Birthplace : New York City, New York

Team : Golden State Warriors, Indiana Pacers

Position : Small forward

A consummate professional and skilled sharpshooter, Brooklyn native Chris Mullin was instrumental in the Golden State Warriors' emergence as an offensive powerhouse during the late 1980s. A founding member of the famed "Run TMC" trio, Mullin's quick release and seemingly boundless range struck fear into the hearts of opposing defenses. With a keen eye for the game, Chris Mullin epitomized the ideal role of a team player and left an indelible mark on the league.
